name: Kisspeptin-10
overview: A peptide hormone that plays a critical role in regulating reproductive hormone secretion, particularly in triggering GnRH (gonadotropin-releasing hormone) release. Research has explored its role in fertility and sexual function.
who_should_avoid: individuals with reproductive disorders without endocrine specialist guidance
interactions_notes: Very limited interaction data. May affect reproductive hormones including LH, FSH, and sex hormones. Comprehensive endocrine evaluation essential before use. May interact with hormonal therapies.
dosing_ranges_literature: Clinical research has explored intravenous doses in the microgram range for studying reproductive function. Subcutaneous protocols are less established. Human data is limited.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution with bacteriostatic water, store refrigerated and use within 1-2 weeks.

references.title: Kisspeptin and reproductive axis regulation
references.note: Research on kisspeptin's role in GnRH secretion and puberty.

references.title: Kisspeptin in fertility and reproduction
references.note: Overview of kisspeptin research in reproductive medicine.
